page.title: 19LOCAL NEWS: SHIELDS GAZETTE
page.content: The local newspaper is the{Shields {Gazette and Shipping Telegraph.}The cost of 17p is comparable with other evening newspapers. Main stories on{ {June 11th 1985}included the sale of Frankie's Cafe on the sea-shore, a favourite haunt of tourists for many yerars. Other stories cover the jailing of a Jarrow rapist and the death of a man outside a local nightclub. There are tales of drunken brawls,cases involving drug-taking and many examples of petty and more serious theft. Unemployment too is mentioned,and "lay-offs", redundancies and related criminal offences are featured. In addition the newspaper caters for pressing national news and a good proportion of advertising ranging from small ads to motor car and house sales and also the usual personal notices.
